subject: Made It to Melbourne
event:
We're here, upside down and dangling off the bottom of the world.  The change keeps falling out of our pockets.

The trip took forever was not without its stresses and unpleasantries.  V-Australia was great, but United Airlines sucks sour weasels.

comments.article: Have fun down in Australia! And yes, United Airlines is awful. I spent 3 extra days with no bag (they wouldn't let us have them off the "broken" plane) trying to get home from abroad. Here's hoping your experiences there and flight back are more enjoyable.

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: Just make sure you're not flying Oceanic when you leave!
Welcome!
Well, I hope the rest of your trip won't be as unpleasant as the flight. Enjoy the convention! =)
Yay! Welcome to Australia. The flight's a bitch, but it's worth it. (and think how it is for us anytime we want to leave the country - :P)
Welcome to Melbourne town.  Enjoy your time here!  Hope you brought your winter woolies, its cold at night still :)

Beware the koalas.

Also, congratulations on the World Fantasy Award nomination for SONGS OF THE DYING EARTH anthology!
All airlines seem similarly afflicted.
Yeah, it seems like I've only heard bad things about United international flights.  Of course, that's how we're flying.  See you soon!
13 hour flight from LA.. did you get anymore writing done?
Ha.  You love flying.
I've never gone Aus to USA but having gone Aus to London I can say long flights thoroughly suck!
comments.subject: flying

comments.article: As someone who has flown across too many oceans, pretty much all American airlines suck. Delta is the worst. AVOID DELTA, EVERYONE.

comments.upictitle: Saithkar - Minister For Apocalyptic Affairs: Agalloch
comments.article: Welcome! Just as a heads up, we Australians disowned Rolf Harris years ago and banished him to Mother England.
Yes, that's true, however we claim him back whenever he does something worthwhile!
comments.subject: Rolf Harris

comments.article: Do toilets really flush the other way around down there?
What happens if you fly along the equator and then flush the toilet?
I don't know what happened to US airlines, but they are awful compared to virtually every other country's airlines that I am aware of.

We went to Australia on United three years ago.  If we had been going to AussieCon this year I think we would have tried to take Quantas.  My favorite airline remains Air New Zealand.  There is nothing comfortable or endearing about United for overseas flights.

We flew to Australia on Virgin. That was fine.

Our problems were all on the United flight that took us from Albuquerque to LAX.

My name is Rhayvon and I am a very big fan.

I have been looking all over for confirmation on the HBO series based on your novels "A Song of Ice and Fire". I have seen some teasers on youtube but everyone says they are fakes.

This is the only way I can think to find the truth. I am sorry if you didnt want this to be a place for fan freeks to question you. Hope you are enjoying your time in Melbourne!

Thank you,
Rhayvon
comments.subject: HI!

comments.article:
This: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6MophfvUlfI

is the official HBO teaser trailer.
comments.subject: Re: HI!

comments.article:
Welcome to Australia!

Yes, that United flight pretty much sucks (having made it a few times myself). Try Air New Zealand next time around - amazingly worth the extra cost, plus you get to stop over in Auckland if you feel like it!
Hi George, looking forward to meeting you at Galaxy bookshop in Sydney on the 13th Sept :)
comments.subject: Welcome to Australia

comments.article: I've only done the trip once (thus far) since I haven't wanted to go back to the USA since getting here.  But the one thing I learned (and which those who live with me -- and who HAVE flown back and forth several more times -- can confirm), is: ALWAYS TAKE QUANTAS.  Pay the extra $$ and go in comfort.  Haven't flown as much as you (and my livein) have, but I've done enough long-distance flights to say "Bjojoit" is wrong: a few airlines do a better job, and make their chairs more comfortable, the flight (a little) less stressful, and even the food offered more platable.  Rainman was right: fly Quantas.
comments.subject: Flying to OZ

comments.article: I'm surprised someone as savvy as you would ever fly a crap airline like United.  There are two really good airlines down under, Qantas and Air New Zealand.  In fact I'm flying on Qantas from Auckland to Toronto via LA on Tuesday.  Well, the last leg will be American Airlines.  Anyways, hope you get to come back down under on a proper airline.
comments.subject: UAL

comments.article: You're not doing any public appearances in Tasmania are you?
Maybe at Cadbury for another chocolate tour. Was '98 the last stopover?
comments.subject: Tasmania

comments.article: I almost got to visit Australia, but we were told Perth didn't want us there.  CVN-65, WestPac 88.  I doubt I'll ever get another chance.

Sooo glad you got there safe and sound. Big BIG LOVE to you n phipps.
Have a Ball!!
